segments.text: I notice that boy, climbing on an unstable stool, reaching desperately for those cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His determination is impressive, but I can’t help but feel a rush of anxiety watching him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What will happen if he falls? It’s as if the world fades around him, and he can only see that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: That jar is inviting, but the risk he’s taking is so unwise.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away as he teeters there, one wrong move away from disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl beside him is waiting with such eagerness; does she understand the danger, too?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Sometimes, I think children are drawn to danger more than anything else, as if it holds some allure.
segments.speaker: PAR
